item.title: Audrey add a quote by Linda Hogan
item.description: "Perhaps it was the word "God" that was inviting to me, a word I thought I knew too much about. The one who had tortured Job, who had Abraham lift the ax to his son, who, disguised as a whale, had swallowed Jonah. I know now that the name does not refer to any deity, but means simply to call out and pray, to summon." -- Linda Hogan

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "She thought there were no Gods; no one was to blame; and so she evolved this atheist's religion of doing good for the sake of goodness." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "My mother says that pain is hidden in everyone you see. She says try to imagine it like big bunches of flowers that everyone is carrying around with them. Think of your pain like a big bunch of red roses, a beautiful thorn necklace. Everyone has one." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Peter Høeg
item.description: "There's a look of mischief in his eyes. 'Smilla. Why is it that such an elegant and petite girl like you has such a rough voice.' I'm sorry,' I say, 'if I give you the impression that it is only my mouth that's rough. I do my best to be rough all over." -- Peter Høeg

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "I tried out the unfamiliar syllables. They fit. They cracked in my ears like a fist through ice." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "There was nothing I wanted to do more than be unconscious again, wrapped in black, gone away. I was raw. I felt swollen with potential tears, like a water balloon filled to burst. Begging for a pin prick." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "I ached once, hard, like a period typed at the end of a sentence." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "I felt something loosen in me, that shouldn't have loosened. A stitch come undone." -- Gillian Flynn
